marketNews.title: Wholesales Mobil August 2025 Remain at 60 Thousand Level, Down -19% YoY
marketNews.content:
Gaikindo reported that national automobile wholesales in August 2025 were recorded at 61,780 units (down 19% YoY, up 1% MoM), marking a yearly sales decline of around -20% YoY for three consecutive months. The August 2025 sales realization also confirms the weak performance of GIIAS 2025, which was held from July 24 to August 3, 2025. During July and August 2025, the average monthly sales only reached 61,329 units, 17% lower than the July 2024 sales level of 74,230 units, when GIIAS 2024 was held from July 18 to 24, 2024.

The August 2025 sales realization brings the national automobile wholesales for the first eight months of 2025 (8M25) to 500,952 units (down 11% YoY), equivalent to 56-67% of the 2025 target set by Gaikindo, which ranges between 750,000 and 900,000 units (vs. 8M24: 65% realization in 2024).

By brand, Astra International (ASII) recorded lower sales than the industry, causing its market share to fall below 50% in August 2025. This marks the lowest monthly market share for ASII in the last 12 months, although in recent years ASII has occasionally recorded market share below 50%. The low ASII market share was pressured by weak sales of Toyota+Lexus and Daihatsu, which each fell 29% YoY in August 2025. Over 8M25, Toyota+Lexus declined 12% YoY, while Daihatsu fell 25% YoY.

On the competitor side, Suzuki and Mitsubishi recorded year-over-year sales growth in August 2025, with increases of +12% YoY and +5% YoY respectively. We assess that the sales growth of both was driven by positive consumer response to the launch of the Suzuki Fronx and Mitsubishi Destinator. Meanwhile, the momentum of Chinese-brand sales halted since July 2025 and continued in August 2025, which we attribute to a price war that makes consumers adopt a wait-and-see attitude.

Key Takeaway: Although automobile sales trends remain weak, we believe that low market expectations mean that actual sales no longer affect the stock price movements of automotive issuers. As we wrote previously, with low market expectations, stock prices can also be influenced by other factors, such as the strategic review currently undertaken by ASII. In the last month, automotive stocks have risen, with ASII +13.3%, AUTO +5.5%, and DRMA +3.6%. Specifically for ASII, we think investors should monitor the progress of the company's capital management plan – including its subsidiaries such as UNTR and AUTO – because a more optimal use of the balance sheet could provide further upside potential for the share price.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said on Wednesday (Sept 10) that the government is open to revising the 2026 State Budget (RAPBN) proposal. He claimed that an agreement has been reached with DPR Commission XI to increase the regional transfer budget in 2026, contrary to the RAPBN 2026 proposal which projected a -25% YoY reduction. Previously, President Prabowo Subianto presented the 2026 RAPBN proposal prepared by Sri Mulyani to the DPR in August 2025, projecting a deficit of 2.48% of GDP and a 10% YoY increase in state revenue. The DPR usually takes until early October to approve the next year's budget.

2. Indonesian Ambassador to the United States, Dwisuryo Indroyono Soesilo, said Indonesia will seek lower U.S. tariffs for palm oil, nickel, copper, and other commodities during negotiations in Washington in September 2025. The government also aims for lower tariffs on shrimp, wood, and furniture.

3. Bank Indonesia reported that the Indonesian Consumer Confidence Index fell to 117.2 in August 2025 (down from 118.1 in July 2025 and 124.4 in August 2024), the lowest level since September 2022. The decline was driven by drops across almost all sub-indices, except income expectations and business activity expectations. The most pronounced declines were in job availability expectations (-2.1 points) and job availability index (-2.2 points).

4. Bank Indonesia forecasts retail sales in August 2025 to grow +2.7% YoY, although it expects a -0.3% MoM contraction. In July 2025, retail sales grew +4.7% YoY but contracted -4.1% MoM, lower than the bank's projection of +4.8% YoY and -4% MoM.

5. Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs Secretary Susiwijono Moegiarso said that electric motor incentives will be continued and bundled into the Q3 2025 stimulus package. The Ministry of Finance had prepared a stimulus of IDR 10.8 trillion for Q3 2025 to sustain economic growth. She also mentioned that Economy Minister Airlangga Hartarto is preparing programs for 2026, and the ministry is reviewing technical certainty, incentive size, implementation timing, and new mechanisms to make incentives more accessible.

6. The government plans to set the selling price of electricity from waste-to-energy power plants (PLTSa) to PLN at 20 US cents per kWh, up from the previous ceiling of 13.35 US cents per kWh. Deputy Energy Minister Yuliot Tanjung explained that the increase is due to the removal of the "tipping fee" scheme in the draft revision of Presidential Regulation No. 35/2018. The revision is expected to be finalized this month.

7. Pertamina CEO Simon Aloysius Mantiri announced that the company plans to merge its refinery, shipping, and retail operations to improve core business efficiency, with completion expected by the end of 2025. Non-core businesses will be merged with similar state-owned enterprises, and discussions are ongoing with Garuda Indonesia ($GIAA) to merge Pelita Air with Garuda.

8. Futura Energi Global (FUTR) announced that PT Aurora Dhana Nusantara completed the purchase of approximately 3 billion (45%) FUTR shares at IDR 11 per share, totaling about IDR 32.8 billion. Previously, FUTR disclosed that PT Aurora Dhana Nusantara signed a term sheet to acquire about 3.3 billion (49.325%) FUTR shares from existing shareholders PT Digital Futurama Global.

marketNews.content: "My suggestion is to involve the private sector so that government-owned goods become more competitive in price and quality instead of being monopolized." – michaeljamesbio

tickerNews.content: By brand, Astra International (ASII) recorded lower sales than the industry, causing its market share to fall below 50% in August 2025. This marks the lowest monthly market share for ASII in the last 12 months, although in recent years ASII has occasionally recorded market share below 50%. The low ASII market share was pressured by weak sales of Toyota+Lexus and Daihatsu, which each fell 29% YoY in August 2025.

tickerNews.title: AUTO Stock Gains 5.5% in the Last Month
tickerNews.content: In the last month, automotive stocks have risen, with ASII +13.3%, AUTO +5.5%, and DRMA +3.6%.

tickerNews.title: DRMA Stock Gains 3.6% in the Last Month
tickerNews.content: In the last month, automotive stocks have risen, with ASII +13.3%, AUTO +5.5%, and DRMA +3.6%.

tickerNews.title: UNTR Considered in ASII Capital Management Review
tickerNews.content: Specifically for ASII, we think investors should monitor the progress of the company's capital management plan – including its subsidiaries such as UNTR and AUTO – because a more optimal use of the balance sheet could provide further upside potential for the share price.

tickerNews.title: SGRO Potential Sale by Sampoerna Family
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported on Wednesday (Sept 10) that the Sampoerna family is considering selling 65.7% of its stake in Sampoerna Agro. Bloomberg sources said the transaction could reflect a valuation of SGRO between USD 500-700 million or IDR 8.2-11.5 trillion. For comparison, SGRO's market cap was around IDR 7.9 trillion on Wednesday (Sept 10). Bloomberg said the family is working with financial advisors through Twinwood Family Holdings Ltd. to gauge buyer interest. The consideration is still under discussion and may not result in any transaction, according to Bloomberg. SGRO representatives have not responded.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Pursues Acquisition of LINK
tickerNews.content: The Director of Solusi Sinergi Digital, Shannedy Ong, said that the company is currently in the process of offering to acquire shares of Link Net (LINK). However, Shannedy explained that they are bound by a non-disclosure agreement with shareholders, so details cannot be disclosed. Previously, DealStreetAsia reported in August 2025 that Axiata was in the final stage of selling a majority stake in LINK, with an estimated value of over USD 1 billion, potentially becoming one of the largest digital infrastructure deals in Southeast Asia this year. DealStreetAsia sources mentioned that WIFI and I Squared Capital are the leading potential buyers.

tickerNews.title: BREN Shares Sold by Green Era
tickerNews.content: A shareholder of Barito Renewables Energy affiliated with the controlling entity, Green Era Pte. Ltd., sold approximately 87.7 million BREN shares on Sept 3-9, 2025 at an average price of IDR 8,416 per share. The total transaction value was about IDR 737.9 billion and was done to increase the free float of shares in the market. After this transaction, Green Era's ownership fell from about 22.08% to about 22.02%.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Plans Expansion of Hospitals
tickerNews.content: The Vice President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Yulisar Khiat, said the company plans to add three hospitals in 2026, consisting of two new hospitals and one acquisition. HEAL currently has 51 hospitals with a total of 8,287 beds. For this year's expansion, the company expects the two new hospitals in Bali and Salatiga to be completed by the end of 2025. Business media reported that by 2030, HEAL aims to have a total of 65-70 hospitals with 12,000-15,000 beds.

tickerNews.title: ITMG Increases Stake in NICE
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Indo Tambangraya Megah, Mulianto, said the company is opening opportunities to increase cooperation or ownership share in Adhi Kartiko Pratama (NICE). Previously, ITMG bought a 9.62% stake in NICE at IDR 438 per share on July 4, 2025. Mulianto explained that ITMG's entry as an investor in NICE reflects the company's commitment to participate in the electrification trend through nickel development.

tickerNews.title: MIKA Plans New Hospitals
tickerNews.content: The Head of Investor Relations of Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat, Aditya Widjaja, said the company has seven land parcels for new hospital construction. Of these, MIKA has started building three hospitals, including one in Sidoarjo expected to operate in Q3 2025 and two others expected in Q3 2026. The capex allocation for the three hospitals is about IDR 950 billion, aligned with the 2025 capex plan. The remaining four lands will start groundbreaking in 2026, targeting 1-2 hospital openings per year with an estimated capex of IDR 200 billion per hospital. The maximum capacity of the seven locations is 200 beds each, totaling 1,400 beds (vs. 4,160 beds in H1 2025).

tickerNews.title: PTPP Secures New Contracts
tickerNews.content: PT PP recorded new contract values of approximately IDR 15.3 trillion during 8M25 (down 19.8% YoY), equivalent to 53.6% of the 2025 target of IDR 28.5 trillion. The new contract value was dominated by projects from state-owned enterprises (51.2%), followed by private sector (31%) and government (17.8%).

tickerNews.title: BWPT Announces Capex Expansion
tickerNews.content: The Director of Eagle High Plantations, Choong Kam Loong, said the company will allocate around IDR 1.66 trillion in capex for the 2025-2029 period, mainly for adding plant capacity, expanding energy, and renewing heavy equipment. BWPT plans to add two palm oil mills (PKS) in East Kalimantan and one PKS in Papua, increasing production capacity by 180,000 tons per year. Business media reported that BWPT currently has a total plantation area of 87,000 hectares and PKS capacity of 2.2 million tons per year.

tickerNews.title: EXCL Shares Purchased by Directors
tickerNews.content: Two members of the XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera board, Sanjay Kumar Gordhan A. Vaghasia and David Arcelus Oses, each bought 150,000 shares and approximately 1.6 million shares of EXCL respectively at an average price of IDR 2,580 per share on September 9, 2025. The total transaction value for both was about IDR 4.6 billion. After the transaction, Sanjay Kumar Gordhan A. Vaghasia's direct ownership in EXCL increased from 0.0008% to 0.0016%, while David Arcelus Oses' ownership rose from zero to 0.0089%.

tickerNews.title: ARKO Signs PLTA Power Purchase Agreement
tickerNews.content: Arkora Hydro, through its subsidiary PT Nosu Hydro, signed a 20 MW hydro-power purchase agreement for the Pongbembe PLTA with PLN for 30 years. The contract value was not disclosed. The Pongbembe PLTA project is financed by a loan of IDR 150 billion from its parent company United Tractors (UNTR) taken in mid-2024.
